New Records: Kuldeep Yadav took 3 wickets and scored 19 runs in 4 overs, a significant performance in the semi-final.
Key Match Events: India scored 171/7 after batting first and England was bundled out for 103.
Axar Patel took 3 wickets and contributed 23 runs with the bat, playing a crucial role in India's victory.
Kuldeep Yadav was awarded the Player of the Match for his exceptional spell of 4-0-19-3.
Pre-Game Insights: England opted to bowl first despite the weather conditions clearing up.
Both teams were unchanged from their previous matches.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma praised the team's adaptability and performance, especially highlighting Virat Kohli's ability and the spinners' dominance.
Jos Buttler acknowledged India's superior performance and expressed pride in England's effort.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a significant milestone for India, reaching the finals of three consecutive ICC tournaments.
The game was completed in 16.4 overs, showcasing India's dominance with both bat and ball.
